TopicTitle: cBBp SPC Pack v0.4: Fixed Failcan RCS and added some adapter pieces. Enjoy.

Articles.Content: This KOSMOS pack is pretty interesting. Good to see that there\'ll be more space station parts for KSP. Your new engine looks good.
I ma texturing it now thanks. as for the Soviet stuff pack. i don;t know how long that will take. SS wants it out at feb th but i don;t think he knows how hard modelling is
Pelf\'s space station he\'s working on is also a joint effort. I really need to get texturing when I get home.

did up the nozzle textures. includes:

Regenerative Ablative Coated Cooling Lines

Combustion Plate

Nozzle Extension

Exhaust Gas Thermal Barrier Extrusion Vents

did up the nozzle textures. includes:

Regenerative Ablative Coated Cooling Lines

Combustion Plate

Nozzle Extension

Exhaust Gas Thermal Barrier Extrusion Vents

it\'s..... it\'s beatiful

a question, i want to do this engine in Autodesk Inventor but i can\'t find any blueprints with dimension... and i am a very bad designer for a part without that dimension

where i can find a complete blueprint?

thanks ;D

Sorry. Couldn\'t help you there. I just get a bunch of pictures and use mt Aspergers Analyitical Gift/Curse to break it into required details :/

For example that is a fusion of Merlin Chamber, F-1a Oxidizer/Fuel Tubing paths, and a J-2 Exhaust and turbine setup.

SoI just sat and looked at pictures and adjusted the model until i felt it looked similar enough but with my own ideas for it.
no problem thanks!

BTW awesome footage You can see how well the pump exhaust gas constants the Combustion f the fuels. It even holds it a few feet after the end of the nozzle. Pretty awesome

Apollo 11 Saturn V Launch Lift off - High Speed Cam - HD 720p
also, people complain about failcan not being 1 meter in diameter. i think it is just perfect size wise.
Well, your screen pretty much shows its bigger than the stock parts, which means it is indeed greater than 1meter by some fraction (something like 5% probably)
it is 1.5 meter.

oh well there ya go, nothing wrong with it being that size.

People probably base it being 1m on the fact that the Falcon is the same diameter as the Dragon capsule, and capsule standard size is 1m, and in reality, the Falcon is on the low end of rocketry, size-wise (production rocketry that is)
actually it si 3.4m radius. it is rather wide. The Dragon capsule is actually wider than the rocket itself. it is not small.

lol, kerbal things are scaled down, though, so 3 meters in real life is pretty small.

For instance, the Apollo CSM was 12 feet, 10 inches (or 3.9 meters) and the Coffin-like Mercury capsule was 3.7 meters.
yes i realize this.
F-2x engine needs something to push into orbit. It is as powerful as 8.1 failcan 9 engines and uses just as much fuel
Lift an entire kerbal-scale saturn V into orbit with a real-scale version of the F-2X!

Lift an entire kerbal-scale saturn V into orbit with a real-scale version of the F-2X!

it is ahrdly real scale. just large:) as it should be
hey look a bunch of Soviet stuff

well While i am thinking of what to do I cranked out some basic veyr basic things that will eventually be carved up based on Segas stuff. (used it as a negative to mold them changed some things i felt looked a bit off by importing images of the things.

Salyut 1 & 4 and Alamaz.

I am starting to lean towards the idea of cutting them into various peoces and letting the user arrange them as they wish. however i am not sure yet. i have to decide. But in thsi way the user could make mir or Salyut. or somethign completely different but all lok the same.
They look fantastic! Cutting them into pieces would be very good. That\'d give a lot of design freedom, not just to stations, but to spaceships as well.
They\'re also intended to be used as attachments to other stations.

it would work if I could get roll control and The rudder to work right. but alas...

http://youtu.be/VvKH3foD5JI

you can\'t land with >15Â°

K I think I got most of them?

Thanks To Segas work I made the basics shapes and i think i have determined the Desired Details. Those weird things on the outside of most of them i think i will be making separate pieces for added personal customization. What do you think?
